title: Why are Nidalee spears back to being intercontinental ballistic missiles?
body:
Seriously those things are back to being flat out nukes again, the only thing is now she has crazy cougar damage to go with it.

EDIT:I don't want people to forget the point of this thread in the first place, **Riot explicitly stated that AP Nidalee with her high damage/range and low CD poke was toxic for this game** and reworked her **the thing I am complaining about isn't that she is OP but anti-fun** due to her going back to more or less the same toxic thing she was before.

replies.body:
Nid is broken OP. All the way to challenger if you play her strategically.

Movement speed, Extremely high damage poke, can assassinate squishes like there is no tomorrow. Only draw back is she can be cced, but if you are any good, you would only jump in when all most CC abilities are on CD.
They aren't nukes unless you get hit from a mile away, and if you get hit from a mile away your bad.

Panth is broken too, I mean you can end the game before 30 mins easily, you can take or have anything on the map for the first 25 mins unless the enemies gang up on you.
I don't think this is much of a problem. Early boots let you dodge spears with relative ease. Sticking behind your minions is also a great way to zone her.

It's not a problem they're not as strong as they use to be and incredibly hard to hit compared to what the speed and width use to be.

The only thing that's broken about NID imo is jg nid being able to trigger passive on jg creeps idk why Riot decided to do that

She is useless if she keeps missing the skill shots. Same goes for any skill shot oriented champs. But some champs can land their skills easily like Ahri then someone like Nid. Becasue Nid Spear has a large range she can land skillshots on FOW, that is a  huge plus.  I mean how the hell can you dodge something when you don't expect it. She can stay out of your vision and get you by surprise.

It's not really that bad, the main reason why people have such a hatred/problem with Nidalee as a champion is because her kit makes her extremely annoying to play against.

Riot should hire people whom play the game at a high level or have a high understanding of the MOBA genre to buff/nerf accordingly, instead however they rely on looking at what is popular/what the community complains about.

For example some champs that I think are really broken atm

Kassadin, Azir, Cass, Annie, Panth, Fiora, Poppy etc etc. I can list more and more oh and Hecarim fkin stupid champ

Yet the community will only complain about like half of those champs for a few reasons either they aren't really annoying to play against/aren't played enough or the players on them most of the time just suck I think this can apply to Azir and Kassadin,  because of this riot won't ever touch the champion.

However you get champs like Nid where the community will cry and cry and cry forcing Riot to give in and nerf them.

Like poppy hasn't been touched for ages neither has fiora and neither has panth there simply just isn't enough complaint from the playerbase to force Riot to balance them.

Yet they'll nerf a champ like Nid who in my opinion isn't OP only Nid jg is atm but I assume they will take away the change they made to her lsat patch.

tldr; Nidalee (only jg is op cause of recent change) isn't OP she is just annoying to play against which results in more people complaining about her which results in Riot giving in and nerfing her

Like it's not even hard to dodge Nid spears

It is easy to dodge her spears. Also not many people can play Azir, Fiora, and Poppy extremely well like they do with Nid. I have seen many good nid players but few good Fiora, or poppy players.

I think it is because people can master her fairly easy and do decently most games. Cass is pretty Op like always but to position her in teamfights without getting blownup is really hard, so high  risk and high reward champion also her damage is sustained and not burst like Annie. So Cass is pretty balanced champion. On the other hand,  Nid can be positioned easily. I agree Kassadin and Jayce is broken op and needs a nerf hammer.  Same goes to Annie and Azir. Azir late game damage is godly, the most broken shiet I have ever come across in league. Thresh is broken op too, but not many people can play as she needs to be played.

Another broken duo Que is Kalista and blitz, if blitz can continuously land the hooks then, Kalista can one shot the enemy bot lane. But that too is balanced with the requirements of high coordination, communication and mechanics.

Nid is pretty broken if she is played the way she is meant to be. Poke from a safe distance, bait the enemy CC and summoners and profit. Also make sure Nid is picked into a decent team comp. 

Like you said her spears are fairly easy to dodge, but in poke and mobility compositions where she can distract the enemies and keep them occupied while other team members get the towers or other objectives.
What you said at the end would never happen in  SoloQ and in 5v5 team play teams would know how to play around it if they didn't Nid would be 100% pick/ban but she isn't

> [{quoted}](name=Winter Fox,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=V7KFK85s,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2015-02-09T22:48:20.028+0000)

You got more exposure than me on this game, I would take your word for the truth. Nid still has lots of potential to create pressure all across the map with her mobility especially in the jungle. That is what you call as annoying.  She makes the enemies react to her moves/plays rather than enemies making their own plays. She can get lots of either coverage/control of the map in less time at all points of the game, when compared to other champs. At the end of the day, whoever make the enemies dance to their tunes has an upper hand and most likely win the game. Every strategy has it own weakness and flaws, but whoever executes them better than the other team , wins the game. it is not champions fault if the people who play her don't use her the way she is meant to be. Maybe that is why they gave nid the good jungle buff, knowing she got the potential to get control of the map, at-least through ward coverage and make some plays. Or people still have not realized her full potential, it is easy to play Nidalee that does not mean anyone has completely mastered her. As I said before, at the end of the day, you got more exposure on this game than me, so you know better.
